pentago

Class Pentago

  • java.lang.Object
    • pentago.Pentago

  • public class Pentago
extends java.lang.Object
    The pentago game class that performs the pentago game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Board board
      The board of the game, all movements and rules will be applied to this board.
      private Player[] players
      A two member array that holds the game players, first member is player1 and second member is player2
      private Player turn
      Current turn of the game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pentago() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void changeTurn()
      Determines next turn of the game and changes turn respectively by simply giving turn to the other player.
      private void doPlaying()
      The game cycle will be handled here.
      private java.lang.String getNextValidMoveString()
      Gets next valid move from turn player and validates syntax of input string and asks for valid move string while input string is invalid.
      private boolean isInvalidateMoveString(java.lang.String moveString)
      Validates syntax of the move string that entered be user.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method of the pentago game.
      private void play()
      Operates as the playing process of the pentago game is implemented here.
      private void playHumanToComputer()
      Performs two player game mode that is playing human to computer.
      private void playHumanToHuman()
      Performs two player game mode that is playing human to human.
      private void printGameResult()
      This method determines the winner or tie state and prints the game results.
      private void printTurn()
      Print current player turn before asking for selected move of current player.
      private void printTurnRotation()
      Print current player turn before asking for selected rotation of current player.
      private void randomInitializePlayers()
      Randomly assigns piece color of two players and prints their colors to console.
      private java.lang.String selectGameMode()
      Gets game mode from user and returns it.
      private boolean validateRotationString(java.lang.String rotationString)
      Validates syntax of the rotation string that entered be user.

        The board of the game, all movements and rules will be applied to this board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pentago

        public Pentago()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method of the pentago game.
        Parameters:
        args - program arguments

      • play

        private void play()
        Operates as the playing process of the pentago game is implemented here. It asks for determining the game type by selecting from one player (play with computer) and two player (play with opponent) and handles moves and board state and game rules and regulations and finally determines the winner (or tie state).

      • selectGameMode

        private java.lang.String selectGameMode()
        Gets game mode from user and returns it.
        Returns:
        game mode

      • playHumanToHuman

        private void playHumanToHuman()
        Performs two player game mode that is playing human to human.

      • playHumanToComputer

        private void playHumanToComputer()
        Performs two player game mode that is playing human to computer. The player1 will be human player and the player2 will be computer player.

      • doPlaying

        private void doPlaying()
        The game cycle will be handled here.

      • getNextValidMoveString

        private java.lang.String getNextValidMoveString()
        Gets next valid move from turn player and validates syntax of input string and asks for valid move string while input string is invalid. finally returns the valid move string.
        Returns:
        valid move string

      • printTurnRotation

        private void printTurnRotation()
        Print current player turn before asking for selected rotation of current player.

      • changeTurn

        private void changeTurn()
        Determines next turn of the game and changes turn respectively by simply giving turn to the other player.

      • printGameResult

        private void printGameResult()
        This method determines the winner or tie state and prints the game results.

      • isInvalidateMoveString

        private boolean isInvalidateMoveString(java.lang.String moveString)
        Validates syntax of the move string that entered be user. The input string format is "B C" that 'B' part is block number in range 1 to 4 and 'C' part is cell number in range 1 to 9.
        Parameters:
        moveString - validating move string
        Returns:
        true if the move string is valid, false otherwise

      • validateRotationString

        private boolean validateRotationString(java.lang.String rotationString)
        Validates syntax of the rotation string that entered be user. The input string format is "B R" that 'B' part is block number in range 1 to 4 and 'R ' part is even 'c' for clockwise rotation or 'a' for anti-clockwise rotation.
        Parameters:
        rotationString - validating rotation string
        Returns:
        true if the rotation string is valid, false otherwise

      • printTurn

        private void printTurn()
        Print current player turn before asking for selected move of current player.

      • randomInitializePlayers

        private void randomInitializePlayers()
        Randomly assigns piece color of two players and prints their colors to console.
